thread.title: Explosion blows out windows of Parkdale apartment
thread.title_full: Explosion blows out windows of Parkdale apartment | Toronto Star

author: Brennan Doherty
title: Explosion blows out windows of Parkdale apartment
text:
An explosion blew out the windows of an apartment unit in a Parkdale highrise Saturday afternoon, injuring two people. Several witnesses called police about the explosion shortly before 3:30 p.m., said Toronto police Const. Allyson Douglas-Cook. Emergency crews rushed to the highrise, near Lansdowne Ave and Queen St W.
Debris has littered the area, Douglas-Cook said.
A man and woman were taken to a local hospital with minor injuries, according to paramedics.
Toronto Fire brought in the haz-mat crew to investigate the scene, as well as an investigator for the fire marshalâ€™s office.
 West Lodge Ave. is now closed at Seaforth Ave., just north of Queen St. W., while emergency crews investigate.
With files from Andrej Ivanov
